      1 package codehost
      2 
      3 import (
      4 	"fmt"
      5 	"os"
      6 	"strings"
      7 
      8 	"github.com/xanzy/go-gitlab"
      9 )
     10 
     11 // GitLabCodeHost is an implementation of CodeHost for a GitLab instance.
     12 type GitLabCodeHost struct {
     13 	namespaces []string
     14 
     15 	client *gitlab.Client
     16 }
     17 
     18 // NewGitLabCodeHost creates a new GitLabCodeHost given CLI-supplied key-value parameters.
     19 // It allows specification of a custom GitLab base URL, and a whitelist of project namespaces.
     20 func NewGitLabCodeHost(params map[string]string) (CodeHost, error) {
     21 	// GitLab instance base URL
     22 	baseURL := params["base-url"]
     23 	if baseURL == "" {
     24 		baseURL = "https://gitlab.com"
     25 	}
     26 	apiBaseURL := strings.TrimSuffix(baseURL, "/") + "/api/v4"
     27 
     28 	// API access token, supplied either as a parameter or stored in the environment
     29 	accessToken := params["access-token"]
     30 	if accessToken == "" {
     31 		accessToken = os.Getenv("GITLAB_ACCESS_TOKEN")
     32 	}
     33 	if accessToken == "" {
     34 		return nil, fmt.Errorf("gitlab: no access token specified")
     35 	}
     36 
     37 	// Optionally specify repository namespaces to list for indexing, comma-delimited
     38 	var namespaces []string
     39 	if joinedNamespaces := params["namespaces"]; joinedNamespaces != "" {
     40 		namespaces = strings.Split(joinedNamespaces, ",")
     41 	}
     42 
     43 	client := gitlab.NewClient(nil, accessToken)
     44 
     45 	if err := client.SetBaseURL(apiBaseURL); err != nil {
     46 		return nil, fmt.Errorf("gitlab: error setting base URL: err=%v", err)
     47 	}
     48 
     49 	return &GitLabCodeHost{namespaces, client}, nil
     50 }
     51 
     52 // ListProjects paginates through the GitLab API to retrieve all projects. This method also filters
     53 // the retrieved projects so that only whitelisted namespaces are returned.
     54 func (gl *GitLabCodeHost) ListProjects() ([]*Project, error) {
     55 	var fetchPaginatedProjects func(page int) ([]*Project, error)
     56 
     57 	// Reshape the GitLab project object into the generic, interface-compliant Project struct.
     58 	mapProject := func(project *gitlab.Project) *Project {
     59 		baseURL := gl.client.BaseURL()
     60 		urlPattern := fmt.Sprintf(
     61 			"%s://%s/{name}/blob/{version}/{path}#L{lno}",
     62 			baseURL.Scheme,
     63 			baseURL.Host,
     64 		)
     65 
     66 		return &Project{
     67 			Name:       project.PathWithNamespace,
     68 			Revision:   project.DefaultBranch,
     69 			Remote:     project.SSHURLToRepo,
     70 			URLPattern: urlPattern,
     71 		}
     72 	}
     73 
     74 	// Apply the project namespace whitelist filter predicate to a list of Projects.
     75 	applyNamespaceFilter := func(projects []*Project) []*Project {
     76 		var filtered []*Project
     77 
     78 		predicate := func(project *Project) bool {
     79 			for _, namespace := range gl.namespaces {
     80 				if strings.HasPrefix(project.Name, fmt.Sprintf("%s/", namespace)) {
     81 					return true
     82 				}
     83 			}
     84 
     85 			// Only consider the filter if a nonzero number of whitelist entries are present
     86 			return len(gl.namespaces) == 0
     87 		}
     88 
     89 		for _, project := range projects {
     90 			if predicate(project) {
     91 				filtered = append(filtered, project)
     92 			}
     93 		}
     94 
     95 		return filtered
     96 	}
     97 
     98 	// Use the GitLab API to fetch all projects, page by page.
     99 	fetchPaginatedProjects = func(page int) ([]*Project, error) {
    100 		var projects []*Project
    101 		var empty []*Project
    102 
    103 		opts := &gitlab.ListProjectsOptions{
    104 			ListOptions: gitlab.ListOptions{
    105 				Page:    page,
    106 				PerPage: 100,
    107 			},
    108 		}
    109 
    110 		gitlabProjects, resp, err := gl.client.Projects.ListProjects(opts)
    111 		if err != nil {
    112 			return empty, err
    113 		}
    114 
    115 		for _, gitlabProject := range gitlabProjects {
    116 			projects = append(projects, mapProject(gitlabProject))
    117 		}
    118 
    119 		if resp.NextPage == 0 {
    120 			return applyNamespaceFilter(projects), nil
    121 		}
    122 
    123 		additionalProjects, err := fetchPaginatedProjects(resp.NextPage)
    124 		if err != nil {
    125 			return empty, nil
    126 		}
    127 
    128 		return applyNamespaceFilter(append(projects, additionalProjects...)), nil
    129 	}
    130 
    131 	return fetchPaginatedProjects(1)
    132 }
